implementation.useCase: Law&Company built SuperLawyer, South Korea's first AI legal assistant that helps lawyers reduce time spent on legal research and document preparation while maintaining high accuracy for sensitive legal work. The platform uses Claude to streamline legal research, precedent analysis, document drafting and creation, case law summarization, document-based conversation, and regulatory compliance checking.
implementation.problem: The legal industry faces the challenge of handling complex cases while managing routine document preparation and research. In South Korea's legal sector, lawyers struggle to balance client meetings and court appearances with time-consuming documentation tasks. For many firms, a single case requires hours of research and document preparation, creating bottlenecks that limit their ability to serve more clients.
implementation.model: Claude 3.5 Sonnet (mentioned as a recent upgrade)
implementation.integrationMethod: Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) system with function-calling capabilities, implemented within a flexible architecture that can accommodate various AI models

technicalDetails.architecture: Flexible architecture that can accommodate various AI models while enabling easy updates to system prompts and experiments with diverse data implementations. Includes a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) system that allows Claude to reference relevant legal data before responding.
technicalDetails.promptEngineering: The team continues to fine-tune Claude's system prompts to optimize performance according to their standards. Claude's function-calling capabilities help organize information in the needed sequence for each unique user request.
technicalDetails.challenges: The platform initially faced scaling challenges as user numbers surged, requiring an expansion of API usage limits.
technicalDetails.solutions: With support from Anthropic's customer service team, they quickly resolved scaling issues to maintain service reliability. They also secured an exclusive supply contract with Park Young Sa, South Korea's leading legal publishing house, to enhance their AI capabilities and improve response quality.
technicalDetails.scale: 6,000 users representing 20% of South Korean practicing lawyers, with plans to extend Claude's capabilities across their product suite, including LawTalk (1.3 million monthly visitors) and Big Case.
